meanings.sent1: She managed to outgain her classmates in the math competition.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to outgain his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outgain the birds in collecting nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The rising star aimed to outgain all expectations in her performance.
meanings.sent5: The determined student was determined to outgain all obstacles in her path to success.

meanings.definition: To gain more than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: He always tries to outgain his siblings in the number of books read each month.
meanings.sent2: The company worked hard to outgain its competitors in market share.
meanings.sent3: The little girl wanted to outgain her friends in the number of candies collected.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to outgain its banks during the heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious team aimed to outgain all previous sales records this quarter.
